/* === Color name badge + visible timestamp on highlight cards === */
.highlight-item-card { position: relative; }

/* Badge (uses either data-color-name or a fallback by class) */
.highlight-item-card::before {
  content: attr(data-color-name);
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  left: 10px;
  padding: 2px 6px;
  border-radius: 999px;
  border: 1px solid var(--background-modifier-border);
  background: var(--background-secondary);
  color: var(--text-muted);
  font-size: 10px;
  line-height: 1;
}
/* Fallbacks if the data attribute isn’t present */
.highlight-item-card.highlight-color-yellow::before { content: "Yellow"; }
.highlight-item-card.highlight-color-red::before    { content: "Red"; }
.highlight-item-card.highlight-color-teal::before   { content: "Teal"; }
.highlight-item-card.highlight-color-blue::before   { content: "Blue"; }
.highlight-item-card.highlight-color-green::before  { content: "Green"; }

/* Make the timestamp show fully (no clipping/truncation) */
.highlight-timestamp-info { 
  display: inline-flex; 
  gap: 6px; 
  white-space: nowrap; 
}
.highlight-timestamp-info time { 
  max-width: none !important; 
  overflow: visible !important; 
}
/* If the right side was squeezing the date, give it its own track */
.highlight-actions { 
  display: grid; 
  grid-template-columns: 1fr auto; 
  align-items: center; 
}

```
// After creating the card element:
const card = container.createDiv({ cls: 'highlight-item-card' });

// Derive a friendly color name:
const colorName =
  (this.settings.extraColors?.find(c => c.doc === h.color || c.ui === h.color)?.name) ??
  (h.color ? h.color.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + h.color.slice(1) : "—");
card.setAttribute("data-color-name", colorName);

// Ensure timestamp is present and respects Settings → Date format:
if (this.settings.showTimestamps) {
  const ts = moment(h.createdAt ?? Date.now()).format(this.settings.dateFormat);
  card.createDiv({ cls: "highlight-timestamp-info" }).setText(ts);
}
```

```
// Normalize "#abc", "#aabbcc", or rgb(...) to "#aabbcc"
private normalizeHex(hex?: string): string {
  if (!hex) return '';
  let h = hex.trim().toLowerCase();
  if (h.startsWith('rgba') || h.startsWith('rgb')) {
    const nums = h.replace(/rgba?\(|\)/g, '').split(',').map(x => parseFloat(x.trim()));
    const toHex = (n:number) => ('0' + Math.max(0, Math.min(255, Math.round(n))).toString(16)).slice(-2);
    return '#' + toHex(nums[0]||0) + toHex(nums[1]||0) + toHex(nums[2]||0);
  }
  if (h.startsWith('#')) h = h.slice(1);
  if (h.length === 8) h = h.slice(0,6);
  if (h.length === 3) h = h.split('').map(c => c + c).join('');
  if (h.length < 6) h = (h + '000000').slice(0,6);
  return '#' + h;
}

// Look up the friendly name from Settings → Highlights palette
private resolveColorName(docHex: string): string {
  const s = this.plugin.settings;
  const norm = this.normalizeHex(docHex);
  const docs = s.customColorsDoc ?? s.customColors;
  const bases = [
    { doc: docs.yellow, name: s.customColorNames?.yellow },
    { doc: docs.red,    name: s.customColorNames?.red },
    { doc: docs.teal,   name: s.customColorNames?.teal },
    { doc: docs.blue,   name: s.customColorNames?.blue },
    { doc: docs.green,  name: s.customColorNames?.green },
  ];
  for (const b of bases) {
    if (this.normalizeHex(b.doc) === norm &amp;&amp; (b.name||'').trim()) return (b.name||'').trim();
  }
  const extras = (s.extraColors || []);
  const found = extras.find(c =>
    this.normalizeHex(c.doc) === norm || this.normalizeHex(c.ui) === norm
  );
  return (found?.name || '').trim();
}
```

/* === Color-name badge on cards === */
.highlight-item-card { position: relative; }
.highlight-item-card::before {
  content: attr(data-color-name);
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  left: 10px;
  padding: 2px 8px;
  border-radius: 999px;
  border: 1px solid var(--background-modifier-border);
  background: var(--background-secondary);
  color: var(--text-muted);
  font-size: 10px;
  line-height: 1;
  pointer-events: none;
}

/* === Let timestamps breathe so the full date shows === */
.highlight-timestamp-container { 
  margin-left: auto; 
  max-width: none; 
  overflow: visible; 
}
.highlight-timestamp-info { 
  max-width: none; 
  white-space: nowrap; 
}
/* If actions were squeezing it, give stats + timestamp their own lanes */
.highlight-info-line { 
  display: grid; 
  grid-template-columns: 1fr auto; 
  align-items: center; 
  gap: 8px;
}

<p data-start="4232" data-end="4280"><strong data-start="4232" data-end="4278" data-is-only-node="">3) Make sure the date is actually rendered</strong></p>

<ul data-start="4287" data-end="4428">
<li data-start="4287" data-end="4336">
<p data-start="4289" data-end="4336"><strong data-start="4289" data-end="4319" data-is-only-node="">Settings → Show timestamps</strong>: Turn this on.</p>

<li data-start="4339" data-end="4424">
<p data-start="4341" data-end="4424"><strong data-start="4341" data-end="4367" data-is-only-node="">Settings → Date format</strong>: Set your preferred format (e.g., <code data-start="4402" data-end="4420">YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm```).</p>


<p data-start="4431" data-end="4476"><strong data-start="4431" data-end="4474" data-is-only-node="">Optional CSS-only fallback (no rebuild)</strong></p>
> 
<p data-start="4485" data-end="4658">If you can’t rebuild right now, you can still show badges for the <strong data-start="4551" data-end="4571">five base colors</strong> by hard-coding content. This won’t cover custom “Add color” entries, but it’s quick:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="4669" data-end="4970">css<button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none py-1" aria-label="Kopier"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" <p data-start="1207" data-end="1279">The label should appear as a small badge at the top-left of each card.</p>


<p data-start="1286" data-end="1491" data-is-last-node=""><strong data-start="1286" data-end="1304" data-is-only-node="">Why This Works</strong>: The patched <code data-start="1318" data-end="1327">main.js``` matches your highlight color to the palette (including custom “Add color” entries) and writes the exact label into <code data-start="1443" data-end="1460">data-color-name```, which your CSS then displays.</p>

```
// Inside class HighlightRenderer
private addColorNameChip(parent: HTMLElement, highlight: Highlight): void {
  const name = this.resolveColorName(highlight.color || this.plugin.settings.highlightColor);
  if (!name) return;
  const chip = parent.createEl('span', { cls: 'highlight-color-chip' });
  chip.setText(name);
}
```

<p data-start="1454" data-end="1481"><strong data-start="1454" data-end="1478" data-is-only-node="">How it works (quick)</strong>:</p>

<ul data-start="1488" data-end="1862">
<li data-start="1488" data-end="1858">
<p data-start="1490" data-end="1858">When scanning notes, it reads the <code data-start="1524" data-end="1555"><mark ... class="sbh-KEY"...>``` attribute, pulls out the <code data-start="1581" data-end="1593">sbh-<slug>```, and compares that slug to the slugified names in your palette (both base color names and any added colors). When it finds a match, it stores the exact label as <code data-start="1755" data-end="1769">paletteLabel```. The renderer then exposes it as <code data-start="1803" data-end="1820">data-color-name```, which your CSS shows as the badge.</p>

<p data-start="667" data-end="688"><strong data-start="667" data-end="685" data-is-only-node="">What this does</strong>:</p>

<ul data-start="695" data-end="727">
<li data-start="695" data-end="724">
<p data-start="697" data-end="724"><strong data-start="697" data-end="721" data-is-only-node="">Class → name mapping</strong>:</p>


> 
<p data-start="729" data-end="1010">We capture the <code data-start="744" data-end="752"><mark>``` class (e.g., <code data-start="766" data-end="786">sbh-conceptualword```) and save <code data-start="797" data-end="829">markClassSlug="conceptualword"``` on the highlight.

We build a lookup from your palette names → slugs (e.g., <code data-start="911" data-end="927">ConceptualWord``` → <code data-start="930" data-end="946">conceptualword```) and use it to get the <strong data-start="970" data-end="985">exact label</strong> you typed in Settings.</p>


<ul data-start="1017" data-end="1097">
<li data-start="1017" data-end="1094">
<p data-start="1019" data-end="1094"><strong data-start="1019" data-end="1041" data-is-only-node="">Doc-color fallback</strong> (in case a nested <code data-start="1060" data-end="1068"><mark>``` didn’t expose a class):</p>


> 
<p data-start="1099" data-end="1258">If no class slug is available, we match the <strong data-start="1143" data-end="1161">document color</strong> (<code data-start="1163" data-end="1192">style="background: #7C1872"```) against your palette’s <strong data-start="1217" data-end="1235">Document color</strong> (not the UI swatch).</p>


<ul data-start="1265" data-end="1299">
<li data-start="1265" data-end="1296">
<p data-start="1267" data-end="1296"><strong data-start="1267" data-end="1293" data-is-only-node="">Label placement &amp; date</strong>:</p>


> 
<p data-start="1301" data-end="1477">The renderer inserts a small pill <strong data-start="1335" data-end="1360">left of the timestamp</strong> (inside the same container).

CSS changes ensure the timestamp <strong data-start="1429" data-end="1448">never truncates</strong> and the pill stays inline.</p>

<p data-start="1484" data-end="1551"><strong data-start="1484" data-end="1509" data-is-only-node="">Where the changes are</strong> (so you know exactly what’s happening):</p>

<ul data-start="1558" data-end="1578">
<li data-start="1558" data-end="1575">
<p data-start="1560" data-end="1575"><strong data-start="1560" data-end="1573" data-is-only-node=""><code data-start="1562" data-end="1571" data-is-only-node="">main.ts```</strong></p>


> 
<p data-start="1580" data-end="1885"><strong data-start="1580" data-end="1603" data-is-only-node="">Highlight interface</strong>: adds <code data-start="1610" data-end="1634">markClassSlug?: string```.

<strong data-start="1642" data-end="1666">HTML <code data-start="1649" data-end="1657"><mark>``` parser</strong>: extracts <code data-start="1677" data-end="1688">class="…"``` and pushes <code data-start="1700" data-end="1718">{ cls: sbhSlug }``` alongside color.

<strong data-start="1742" data-end="1765">Nested mark handler</strong>: also extracts the class when synthesizing nested matches.

<strong data-start="1831" data-end="1853">Highlight creation</strong>: stores <code data-start="1862" data-end="1882">markClassSlug: cls```.</p>


<ul data-start="1892" data-end="1926">
<li data-start="1892" data-end="1923">
<p data-start="1894" data-end="1923"><strong data-start="1894" data-end="1921" data-is-only-node=""><code data-start="1896" data-end="1919" data-is-only-node="">highlight-renderer.ts```</strong></p>


> 
<p data-start="1928" data-end="2189">Adds helpers to <strong data-start="1944" data-end="1961">slugify names</strong>, <strong data-start="1963" data-end="1980">normalize hex</strong>, and <strong data-start="1986" data-end="2007">resolve the label</strong> from either <code data-start="2020" data-end="2035">markClassSlug``` or <strong data-start="2039" data-end="2052">doc color</strong>.

In <code data-start="2063" data-end="2092">addTimestampToInfoLine(...)```, inserts a badge with the label <strong data-start="2125" data-end="2135">before</strong> the date and sets layout to keep the date readable.</p>


<ul data-start="2196" data-end="2219">
<li data-start="2196" data-end="2216">
<p data-start="2198" data-end="2216"><strong data-start="2198" data-end="2214" data-is-only-node=""><code data-start="2200" data-end="2212" data-is-only-node="">styles.css```</strong></p>


> 
<p data-start="2221" data-end="2468">Ensures <code data-start="2229" data-end="2251">.highlight-info-line``` uses a grid (<code data-start="2265" data-end="2275">1fr auto```) so the right side can grow.

<code data-start="2311" data-end="2343">.highlight-timestamp-container``` uses inline-flex with <code data-start="2366" data-end="2371">gap``` and <code data-start="2376" data-end="2397">white-space: nowrap``` to prevent clipping.

<code data-start="2425" data-end="2449">.highlight-color-badge``` styles the pill.</p>

<p data-start="2475" data-end="2508"><strong data-start="2475" data-end="2505" data-is-only-node="">Why this fits your example</strong>:</p>

<ul data-start="2515" data-end="2532">
<li data-start="2515" data-end="2529">
<p data-start="2517" data-end="2529">Your mark:</p>


> 
<p data-start="2534" data-end="2608"><code data-start="2534" data-end="2606" data-is-only-node=""><mark class="sbh-conceptualword" style="background: #7C1872;">…</mark>```</p>


<ul data-start="2615" data-end="2640">
<li data-start="2615" data-end="2637">

> 
<p data-start="2642" data-end="2863"><strong data-start="2642" data-end="2651" data-is-only-node="">First</strong> we use <code data-start="2659" data-end="2679">sbh-conceptualword``` → slug <code data-start="2687" data-end="2703">conceptualword``` → <strong data-start="2706" data-end="2724">ConceptualWord</strong> (from your palette).

If a class is missing, we <strong data-start="2778" data-end="2790">fallback</strong> to matching <code data-start="2803" data-end="2812">#7C1872``` to the <strong data-start="2820" data-end="2838">Document color</strong> of <strong data-start="2842" data-end="2860">ConceptualWord</strong>.</p>
